overview_of_class: This class examines the economics of government taxation and expenditure policies. Topics covered include externalities and public goods, programs that target the poor such as Medicaid and social insurance programs such as Social Security and Medicare. We also investigate the impact of income taxation on labor supply and savings, and discuss the general theory of social insurance, the U.S. health care system, and health care reform.
name: Elements of Public Finance
title: WCAS ECON 309-0-20 Elements of Public Finance

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: This class will meet twice per week in lecture and have regular discussion sections.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Course grades will be based on two exams and regular assignments.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Public Finance and Public Policy, by Jonathan Gruber, any edition is fine (the ISBN of the 5th edition, the most recent edition, is 978-1464143335).
